tool.name: Paffy tile
tool.description: tiles the records in the PAF file along the query sequence
tool.command: #if $input_paf.ext.endswith('.gz') gunzip -c '$input_paf' | #end if paffy tile --logLevel 'INFO' --outputFile '$out_file' #if not $input_paf.ext.endswith('.gz') --inputFile '$input_paf' #end if
tool.help: Paffy tile processes a PAF file and assigns alignment levels from lowest (best) to highest (worse) along each query sequence. It greedily selects the highest-quality alignment at each query position, effectively producing a tiling of non-overlapping alignments that prioritizes the strongest matches. Annotates alignments with 'tp' and 'tl' tags to indicate the type and tile level (where 1 is the highest), respectively. As output, a new PAF file is generated with tiled alignments.
